ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_women] Guilds and groups
ygData.msgSnippet: I will tell you what, the only guilds I will join are ones where I already know a member of the guild.  One of them that I am a member of, required me to group
ygData.messageBody:
I will tell you what, the only guilds I will join are ones where I already
know a member of the guild. One of them that I am a member of, required me
to group with two of the officers before they would even consider my
application.

The quality of the guilds that I have come across on Tunare, has
deteriorated SEVERELY. You get people who zone in and ooc that they're
looking for a guild. Why don't you take the time to get to know someone?

I used to be a leader of a guild on Tunare, and we were quite stringent
about who could and could not be in our guild.

It was relatively nice. I quit because I was sick of the crap but that was
just personal issues.

I just rejoined a new guild that is like family. They are very small, but
they are SO close to one another. Which is what's important. It's not
important to have 300 people logged on at a time. It's important to be able
to talk to one another and work together.

My 2cp

Soril Tenderleaf
Level 31 Druid
Tunare
